quote.#tail: with respect to certain financial entities.

Too Big to Fail, Too Big to Exist
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

a list of all commercial banks,
			 investment banks, hedge funds, and insurance companies that the

believes are too big to fail, which shall include, but is not limited to, any

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law,
			 not later than 90 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

header.#text:
Report to
			 Congress on institutions that are too big to fail

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall break up entities included on the Too Big To Fail List, so that
			 their failure would no longer cause a catastrophic effect on the United States
			 or global economy without a taxpayer bailout.

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law,
			 beginning 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the

header.#text:
Breaking-up too
			 big to fail institutions

term.#tail:
means any entity that has grown so large that its failure
			 would have a catastrophic effect on the stability of either the financial
			 system or the United States economy without substantial Government
			 assistance.

text.#text: For purposes of this Act, the term
